item.description:
When: Monday October 10th 

EVENT:This was a fantastic bike ride last year! it is a 10 mile tour of Nahant that makes stops at 2 parks with beautiful views of the Boston skyline. A good portion of the ride will be along the coast including a 1 ½ mile stretch down a paved trail right on Nahant Beach, there are a couple of hills as well. Both of the parks have waterside cliffs and we will take short hikes to visit them. Plans also include a stop at “The Tides” restaurant for chowder before we head home. Check: www.nahant.com

Trip's Coordinator: David

MEET: 11AM in front of the Dunkin Donuts snack shack that is just outside the Nahant Beach Parking Lot and adjacent to “The Tides” restaurant. We will park about halfway down the lot and near a beach house with a blue roof. Bring a lunch, some water and a lock for your bike. Look for David at Dunkin Donuts with a Mosaic Cap and a sign. Anyone who wants to take the MBTA train out of Boston David can meet at the Swampscott station at 10:00 for a 2 mile ride over to the “Tides”.

RSVP: Required, use the link above by Thursday Oct 6th.Please include a phone number for contact on the day of the event and let David know if you are going to take the train

COST: No charge for unless you are not a full member, parking is free, just $5 for guest or a non paid member.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: A Columbus Day Bike Ride around Nahant
